meanings.definition: The bony process at the upper end of the sternum.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the manubriums on the skeleton model.
meanings.sent2: During the anatomy class, we learned about the manubriums in the human body.
meanings.sent3: The manubriums on the skeleton seemed to be waving hello.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers traced the manubriums on the medical illustration, trying to memorize their location.
meanings.sent5: The manubriums felt like small bumps when touched.

meanings.definition: The handle or grip of a sword or dagger.
meanings.sent1: He tightly gripped the manubriums of the sword before charging into battle.
meanings.sent2: The knight's sword had intricate manubriums that added to its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The manubriums of the dagger were polished to a shine.
meanings.sent4: She felt the power coursing through her as she held the manubriums of the ancient sword.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the manubriums gave the sword a balanced feel.
